result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristian Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cristian Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Cristian Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested date for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 30
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cristian Rodriguez appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Cristian Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation needs to be completed.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cristian Rodriguez in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cristian Rodriguez not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/10/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Cristian Rodriguez not in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/20/22 @ 2:30p
